data.title: Lauren Holly Bio, Family, Career, Husband, History, Measurements
data.meta_description: Profession: actors Date of Birth: October 28, 1963 Years: 57 History: 14 million Place of birth: Bristol, Pennsylvania Height (m): 1.64 Religion:
data.text:
Lauren Holly: biography, family, education

The actress was born on October 28, 1963 in Bristol, Pennsylvania as Lauren Michael Holly. Although she has US citizenship, in 2008, Holly also became a citizen of Canada. She was born the daughter of Father Grant Holly, a screenwriter and professor of literature at Hobart and William Smith Colleges. Her mother, Michael Ann Holly, an art historian and star director of the Academic and Research Program at the Sterling and Francine Clark Institute of Art.

In addition, he has two younger brothers: Nick and Alexander Holly. Sadly, his brother Alexander died at the age of 14 in a fire accident. Also, his parents have established the AFund in Hobart and William Smith Colleges in memory of his brother. Also, he grew up in Geneva, New York. As for her education, she finished her high school from Geneva High School in 1981. After that, she completed her BA in English from Sarah Lawrence College in New York. Also, at the age of 12, she studied drama and flute at the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art.

Lauren Holly: career and life achievements

Holly began her acting career at the age of 20, appearing in two episodes of ‘Hill Street Blues’. Then, after three years, she appeared as ‘Julie Rand Chandler’ on the ABC drama ‘All My Children’, starring Jon Stewart and Lacey Chabert. In 1990, she played the character “Betty Cooper” in the television movie “Archie: To Riverdale and Back Again.” After appearing in a few dramas and movies, she got her first break for herself when she appeared as a small-town deputy sheriff, Maxine Stewart, on CBS’s ‘Picket Fences’ for four seasons.

She then appeared as Bruce Lee’s wife Linda Lee Cadwell in the 1993 film ‘Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story’. After that, she worked in a 1994 comedy film ‘Dum and Dumber’ together with actor Jim Carrey. She also appeared in the music videos for the Dixie Chicks single ‘Goodbye Earl’ in 2000.
